items.title: Unlicensed driver hears impact of single-vehicle crash that killed three friends near Tarago
items.summary: Nowra man Lachlan Stuckey is facing three charges of negligent driving occasioning death over a single-vehicle car crash which killed three of his friends near Tarago in July last year.

items.title: Most renters avoid heating and cooling homes due to costs
items.summary: A new report finds that about 70 per cent of renters were avoiding heating and cooling their homes to save money. Some experts and advocates are calling for stronger minimum energy standards across the country.

items.title: Australia's teen social media ban has unofficially begun. Here's what you need to know
items.summary: December 4 marked the unofficial start of the teen social media ban. Here's everything you need to know.

items.title: NSW council votes to stop flying Indigenous flags and enforce permissions for Welcome to Country
items.summary: A mayor in southern NSW says removing the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander flags from council meeting chambers will "promote civic neutrality".

items.title: Spotify Wrapped 2025: Bad Bunny takes global top artist spot for fourth time
items.summary: Spotify Wrapped is back for 2025, with Bad Bunny taking the top spot for global artist for a fourth time.

items.title: One player's case against the world's biggest crypto casino
items.summary: Chat logs and gambling data show the tactics used by Australian-run online casino Stake to keep one user hooked.

items.title: Energy watchdog flags 5 per cent fall in power prices amid renewables surge
items.summary: An energy watchdog says more renewable energy is projected to lower prices, but others warn the promise is illusory and more pain is coming.

items.title: Jimmy Barnes: The story behind Working Class Man and his American dream
items.summary: Cold Chisel was over. America beckoned. And Jimmy Barnes was terrified. This is the story of the album that made him, and the song that saved him.

items.title: New police investigation into Lisa Lynnâ€™s death stalls over bill for expert report, family says
items.summary: The family of the late first wife of High Country killer Greg Lynn says a fresh investigation into her death has stalled because police will not pay for an expert report.

items.title: Three issues reveal Albanese government's record on trust and integrity
items.summary: Despite holding a commanding position, Anthony Albanese knows the global trend of sliding trust in government isn't one to be taken lightly.

items.title: Australia to provide Ukraine with $95m funding boost
items.summary: Australia will provide an additional $95 million in military assistance to Ukraine and slap a fresh round of sanctions on ships believed to be part of Moscow's so-called "shadow fleet".

items.title: Australia's oil refineries will need government support to avoid a reliance on fuel imports
items.summary: With just two refineries left and 80 per cent of liquid fuel being imported, experts are warning Australia is increasingly vulnerable to global supply shocks.

items.title: High Court strikes down remote NT public housing rent rises
items.summary: A remote rent policy that saw some Northern Territory residents slugged with hikes of up to $300 a fortnight has been struck down on appeal by the High Court.

items.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Man with alleged links to 'Afghan crew' accused of lying to get home loan
items.summary: Ali Jundi was arrested as part of an investigation into the Alameddine crime family, with police alleging he was part of the "Afghan crew".

items.title: Hobart's AFL stadium vote to pass Tasmania's upper house, but at what cost?
items.summary: A stadium on Hobart's waterfront has gained enough support to pass parliament, after key independents declared on Wednesday they would support the contentious project.

items.title: Footballer sacked, youth worker charged after 'last-minute' intel leads to drug drop police sting
items.summary: A regional Victorian footballer and youth worker are facing drug trafficking charges after being caught with a package allegedly containing illegal drugs.

items.title: Jodie Hill denies involvement in alleged murder of 72-year-old Dimboola man John Hunter
items.summary: A woman on trial for the alleged murder of 72-year-old Victorian man John Hunter tells the Supreme Court she was present when he was attacked but another person was responsible for his death.

items.title: First community-designed, culture-led home from new outback housing initiative arrives in Tennant Creek
items.summary: A one-of-a-kind home, designed with the input of Tennant Creek families, has rolled up the Stuart Highway from Adelaide on a convoy of trucks. It is part of a new initiative aiming to transform housing in remote First Nations communities.

items.title: Coalition has 'no confidence' social media ban will work under Labor
items.summary: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley says Australia's social media ban will not work under Labor, as the federal government rejects YouTube's claim it will make kids "less safe".

items.title: Hobart stadium to pass Tasmanian parliament after support from independents
items.summary: A stadium on Hobart's waterfront has gained enough support to pass parliament, after independents Casey Hiscutt, Bec Thomas and Tania Rattray declared they would support the contentious project.

items.title: What the latest GDP numbers mean for interest rates and the economy
items.summary: Australia's latest economic growth numbers show an economy in generally rude health, but that might result in a rude shock for mortgage borrowers earlier rather than later in 2026.

items.title: Man killed, two others injured in northern NSW shooting
items.summary: A man has died and two others injured following a shooting on a property in Murwillumbah in northern NSW.

items.title: Tasmania's local and state governments to pay $650,000 for Foo Fighters concert in Launceston
items.summary: Tasmania's "biggest concert ever" will take place at Launceston's York Park next month when American rock band Foo Fighters play their only Australian show.

items.title: How to prepare yourself and your child for the social media ban on December 10

items.title: Is it better to sleep naked or wear pyjamas in summer?
items.summary: What you wear to bed can affect the quality of your sleep. And if that's nothing at all, there are a few things to consider.

items.title: Woman dies after being struck by hay bale at Roma Saleyards
items.summary: Police and emergency services were called to the Roma Saleyards this morning after reports a hay bale had fallen on a woman. She died at the scene.

items.title: Search for missing flight MH370 to resume this month, Malaysia says

items.summary: As the United States attempts to broker a peace deal at the Kremlin in Moscow, it is expected a significant funding boost from Canberra to aid Ukraine's war efforts is imminent.

items.summary: Bruce Lehrmann has lost his appeal against a Federal Court ruling that found on the balance of probabilities he raped his then-colleague Brittany Higgins in 2019.

items.summary: Long before Greg Lynn was convicted of murder in Victoria's High Country, his estranged wife died suddenly at home in Mount Macedon. Now, some of those closest to Lisa Lynn are pushing for the coroner to re-examine her death.

items.summary: Hugh Jackman sung the crowd-pleaser Sweet Caroline and even climbed onto the top of the bar counter for the performance.

items.summary: The Winter Egg is made from finely carved rock crystal, covered in a delicate snowflake motif wrought in platinum with 4,500 tiny diamonds.

items.summary: The Gold Coast's long-running cableway proposal has inched forward after councillors redirected funds from First Nations consultation to environmental studies.

items.summary: Indonesia's new visa scheme is being touted as a solution to dual citizenship. But some in the Indonesian community say the visa has "no real benefit" and amounts to a government revenue grab.

items.summary: The independent body in charge of overseeing NSW Police misconduct allegations will today probe the response to Lindy Lucena's fatal bashing in 2023.

items.summary: Australia's longest-running radio show is celebrating 80 years on air, and while so much has changed in farming and broadcasting, the core of The Country Hour remains the same.

items.title: Today in history, December 3: Bhopal gas leak kills thousands in world's worst industrial accident

items.summary: Robert Kennedy tends his resignation as WA electoral commissioner, nine months after a state election that was plagued by issues including long wait-times to vote, and polling booths running out of ballot papers.

items.summary: Days after acting Northern Territory Ombudsman Bronwyn Haack raised the alarm about "inhumane" conditions in overcrowded police cells, the government says just six inmates remain.
